greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n mod lambda(n) where lambda is the Carmichael function (A002322).
comment: a(k) = 1 for k = prime(n) > 2 or k = A002997(n).
a(n) is the smallest k >= 0 such that b^(n-k) == 1 (mod n) for every b coprime to n. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jun 30 2017
link: Michel Lagneau, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: with(numtheory):for n from 1 to 100 do: x:=irem(n,lambda(n)): printf(`%d, `,x):od:
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Nov 13 2012
